title: Understanding the Function and Graph
text: /lim{x,1**-,f(x)} is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$ from the left. Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$1$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x) as it approaches that x-value from the left.

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$ from the left?

title: Limit Value
text: /lim{x,1**-,f(x)}=6. Looking at the left side of the function as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$, we can see that the value of f(x) approaches $$6$$. Remember that there is no difference with an open or closed circle because a limit is the value the graph is approaching from the right and left sides. In this case, we are looking solely at the left side of the function.\n##figure2.gif##
